titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Conception Cicioni Romanello (1924-2000) was Secretary/Treasurer of the Washington Sector of the Philadelphia General Hospital Nursing Alumni Association (known as the Blockley Club).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers from the Blockley Club collected by Connie Romanello. Materials include: minutes (1955-1968), correspondence related to club business, bulletins, banking and tax records, membership lists, and copies of the charter and by-laws of the club. A number of the items in the collection relate to the club's involvement in promoting awareness about Phenylketonuria (PKU). These materials include reprints and articles; press releases from the National Association for Retarded Children; newspaper clippings; minutes from the US Department of Health Education and Welfare; a bottle of PKU reagent test strips. The collection also includes several photos and a 1915 newspaper clipping about American Red Cross nurses.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
